headline.main: Death by the Pack for the Third World

keywords.value: GENERAL AGREEMENT ON TARIFFS AND TRADE
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: King James I of England quite succinctly summarized my position on the use of tobacco in 1604: "A custome lothesome to the Eye, hatefull to the Nose, harmfull to the Brain, dangerous to the Lungs, and in the black stinking fume thereof, nearest resembling the horrible, stigian smoke of the pit that is bottomlesse."
